content.description:
Interesting area with HUGE potential for bouldering and short crack climbs (mostly of the larger sizes). Rock is conglomerate/coarse grained sandstone, exactly like Hassler. Trad routes very similar in characteristic of Hassler with large flakes that are sometimes very suspect and a few solid cracks. The main difference being there a LOT of potential boulder cracks here. Potential for anything between 5-15m. The boulders formed when the upper sandstone layer of Mt Babcock slipped down the lower shale layer, forming a large field of small towers and boulders. The only area here that I could find online information for, and seems to have the most concentrated development, is the Roman Road/Chimney Rock area. However, there is an assortment of TR anchors and bolted routes in other zones.

A lot of routes here are in the sun but still shady options abound. Regardless, it's sub-alpine so may want to wait until snow has melted in these regions. After a hot day climbing in the sun check out the alpine tarn a few minutes up the trail and take a dip.
